qas.question: What was the first name of Sony Music Entertainment, Inc?
In what year was it renamed Columbia Recording Corporation?
In what year was it known as CBS Records?
In what year did it land the name, Sony Music Entertainment?
What company is the only group larger than Sony Music Entertainment?
Who is the Chinese conglomerate who owns SCA?

ABC Records was established in what year?
Sony Corporation of China bought CBS Records in what year?
SME is the world's third largest recorded what?

context: Sony Music Entertainment Inc. (sometimes known as Sony Music or by the initials, SME) is an American music corporation managed and operated by Sony Corporation of America (SCA), a subsidiary of Japanese conglomerate <b5_0>Sony Corporation<b5_0/>. In <b6_0>1929<b6_0/>, the enterprise was first founded as <a0_0>American Record Corporation<a0_0/> (ARC) and, in <a1_0>1938<a1_0/>, was renamed Columbia Recording Corporation, following ARC's acquisition by CBS. In <a2_0><b7_0>1966<b7_0/><a2_0/>, the company was reorganized to become CBS Records. In <a3_0><b8_0>1987<b8_0/><a3_0/>, Sony Corporation of Japan bought the company, and in 1991, renamed it SME. It is the world's second largest recorded <b9_0>music company<b9_0/>, after <a4_0>Universal Music Group.
